data.enText: plow

data.chText: 犁
data.enText: a large piece of farming equipment with one or several curved blades, pulled by a tractor or by animals. It is used for digging and turning over soil, especially before seeds are planted.
the Big Dipper

data.chText: 北斗七星；大熊星座
data.enText: a group of seven bright stars that can only be seen from the northern half of the world
under the plough

data.chText: 用于耕作的；作农田的
data.enText: used for growing crops, not for keeping animals on

data.chText: 犁（田）；耕（地）；翻（土）
data.enText: to dig and turn over a field or other area of land with a plough

data.chText: 犁过的田地
data.enText: ploughed fields
plough a lonely, your own, etc., furrow

data.chText: 自耕孤畴（指自行其是或自得其乐）
data.enText: to do things that other people do not do, or be interested in things that other people are not interested in
plough sth↔back (in/into sth)
plough sth↔back in

data.chText: 犁埋；使秸秆还田
data.enText: to turn over growing crops, grass, etc. with a plough and mix them into the soil to improve its quality

data.chText: 把（利润）再投资
data.enText: to put money made as profit back into a business in order to improve it

data.chText: 所有的钱都再投资到这个公司。
data.enText: The money was all ploughed back into the company.
plough into sb/sth

data.chText: 猛撞；（尤指）撞车

before.enText: especially of a vehicle or its driver

data.enText: to crash violently into sth especially because you are driving too fast or not paying enough attention

data.chText: 一辆卡车猛撞到公共汽车的尾部。
data.enText: A truck ploughed into the back of the bus.
plough sth into sth

data.chText: 把（大批资金）投入；大量投资于
data.enText: to invest a large amount of money in a company or project

data.chText: 政府已投放200多亿元兴建新学校。
data.enText: The government has ploughed more than $20 billion into building new schools.
plough on (with sth)

data.chText: 坚持做，继续进行（艰难或乏味的事）；苦撑
data.enText: to continue doing sth that is difficult or boring

data.chText: 没有人在听她讲话，但她仍不加理会，喋喋不休。
data.enText: No one was listening to her, but she ploughed on regardless .
plough (your way) through sth

data.chText: 费劲地穿越（或通过）
data.enText: to force a way through sth

data.chText: 她从等候的人群中挤过去。
data.enText: She ploughed her way through the waiting crowds.

data.chText: 猛冲过；失控地穿过

before.enText: of a vehicle or an aircraft

data.enText: to go violently through sth, out of control

data.chText: 飞机猛冲过树林。
data.enText: The plane ploughed through the trees.

data.chText: 艰难地进行，缓慢地推进（尤指读书、做报告等）；埋头苦干
data.enText: to make slow progress through sth difficult or boring especially a book, a report, etc.

data.chText: 我得慢慢地埋头阅读几十份法律文件。
data.enText: I had to plough through dozens of legal documents .
plough sth↔up

data.chText: （用犁）开垦；犁地
data.enText: to turn over a field or other area of land with a plough to change it from grass, for example, to land for growing crops

data.chText: 轧翻，碾坏（地面）
data.enText: to break up the surface of the ground by walking or driving across it again and again

data.chText: 乡间小路全让摩托车给轧坏了。
data.enText: The paths get all ploughed up by motorbikes.
under the plough

data.chText: 用于耕作的；作农田的
data.enText: used for growing crops, not for keeping animals on
plough a lonely, your own, etc., furrow

data.chText: 自耕孤畴（指自行其是或自得其乐）
data.enText: to do things that other people do not do, or be interested in things that other people are not interested in
plough sth↔back (in/into sth)
plough sth↔back in

data.enText: The money was all ploughed back into the company.

trans: （通常指为种植作物而）犁（地），翻（土）

tr: a farm tool having one or more heavy blades to break the soil and cut a furrow prior to sowing
to break and turn over earth especially with a plow
example: Farmer Jones plowed his east field last week
turn the earth in the Spring

tr: move in a way resembling that of a plow cutting into or going through the soil
example: The ship plowed through the water

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 plow

value.def: A plough is a large farming tool with sharp blades which is pulled across the soil to turn it over, usually before seeds are planted.
When someone ploughs an area of land, they turn over the soil using a plough.

example.ex: They ploughed nearly 100,000 acres of virgin moorland.
example.tran: 他们犁了将近10万英亩未开垦的高沼地。

example.ex: In Roman times November was a month of hard work in ploughing and sowing.
example.tran: 在古罗马时期，11月是辛勤耕耘和播种的月份。

value.def: If an area of land is under the plough, it is used for growing crops. If land is brought or put under the plough, it is ploughed for the first time and is then used for growing crops.

example.ex: There was not one inch of soil that was not under the plough.
example.tran: 没有一寸土地未被开垦成耕地。

example.ex: ...as we put more and more wilderness under the plough.
example.tran: 随着我们将越来越多的荒地开垦成耕地

trans: （通常指为种植作物而）犁（地），翻（土）
